quest.name: Ill-weather Friends
journal: Adversity acquaints a man with strange bedfellows, as Alphinaud knows only too well.

Even with an army of knights, a direct assault on the Vault would be fruitless. However, were you to enlist the aid of the revolutionaries hiding in the Brume, Lucia believes you may yet have a chance of success. Together with Alphinaud, go and speak with Tataru at the Forgotten Knight and see what she knows of the revolutionaries and their leader.

Tataru knows little and less of the gang you seek, save for the moniker of their leader: the Mongrel. For lack of a better option, Alphinaud bids you take to the streets and question the residents of the Brume.
As expected, the people are not wont to speak of the revolutionaries in their midst. Inform Alphinaud of your failure.

Alphinaud seems wholly unconcerned by your lack of success. And little wonder: one cannot simply ask where a gang of notorious outlaws is hiding and expect to receive an honest answer. By way of consolation, your fruitless efforts have lent credence to Alphinaud's theory that the revolutionaries are being sheltered by the populace...
objectives: Speak with Tataru at the Forgotten Knight.
Question the residents of the Brume.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But how are we to carry out this bold endeavor? Even with an army of knights at our backs, a direct assault on the Vault seems unlikely to succeed.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: You are correct, Master Alphinaud. Not even the assembled might of House Fortemps and the Temple Knights would be sufficient. With the support of another party, however, we may yet stand a chance.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You speak of one of the other High Houses?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Precisely the opposite. I speak of the revolutionaries rumored to reside in the Brume.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: 'Twas these disgruntled Ishgardians who opened the gates of our city to the heretics, I believe.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But of course! If their hatred of the Holy See drove them to such deeds, they might well be persuaded to assist in Ser Aymeric's rescue, knowing the truth he would lay bare...

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Such is my hope, Master Alphinaud. And I would have you and Forename reach out to them.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: As a Temple Knight and sworn servant of the Holy See, any overtures I make are doomed to fail.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: But as outsiders, the two of you may receive a warmer welcome.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Very well. We shall seek out the leader of these revolutionaries, and make our case.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: My thanks. Estinien─will your brothers heed your command if you order them to stand aside?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The dragoons have no love for politics, my lady. They will gladly watch and wait while the highborn fight amongst themselves.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: How very wise. Forename─we should hurry to the Forgotten Knight. Tataru may have knowledge of the revolutionaries.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: The lord commander has need of us...and we of him. We must act now.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I thought the lord commander wiser than this.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Have no fear, Father! My arm will not falter; my shield will not break. I promise you: we shall prevail!

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: If we must risk the fortunes of our house to bring this truth to light, then so be it. But are you truly prepared to do this? To face the Heavens' Ward in battle, if you must?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It would seem that the Forgotten Knight was spared the worst of the earlier chaos...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forename, Alphinaud! Gods, I've been worried sick! It's so good to see you!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And you, Tataru. How did you manage to escape the chaos in the streets?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Gibrillont and the others barricaded the doors until the heretics left. No one was harmed, thankfully. But what about you two? What came of your journey?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: ...You're not serious. What was Ser Aymeric thinking!? I mean, the way you two talk about him, I wouldn't have believed... Anyway, I've heard rumors of the people you're looking for, but I doubt they'll be of much use.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: The only thing I can say with any certainty is that they're led by someone called “the Mongrel.”

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A queer moniker if ever I have heard one─but mayhap it will make the individual in question easier to find. Come, let us all make inquiries below.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If truth be told, I doubt anyone will be willing to speak of this “Mongrel.” But we may still be able to confirm that Tataru's information is correct.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: At first, the people here were a bit standoffish, but with a little effort─and a lot of parley─I've managed to make plenty of friends!

dialogue.name: EDMONT
dialogue.text: Tread warily, MistressMaster Surname. The men and women you seek may misinterpret your intentions.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: So she hopes to find a friend in the enemy of our enemy... Well, well, well...

dialogue.name: THEPOORA01638
dialogue.text: A mongrel? Not sure I catch your meaning. To a blue blood, we're all of us dogs down here.

dialogue.name: THEPOORA01638
dialogue.text: Look around you, miladymilord. Mongrels as far as the eye can see.

dialogue.name: THEPOORB01638
dialogue.text: Eh? What's that? Speak up! I can't hear as well as I used to.

dialogue.name: THEPOORB01638
dialogue.text: Are you whispering? I swear, I can't hear a word you're saying.

dialogue.name: THEPOORC01638
dialogue.text: I don't know a godsdamned thing about the Mongrel, but if I did, you can be sure I wouldn't tell you!

dialogue.name: THEPOORC01638
dialogue.text: Piss off back where you came from, outlander. You'll get nothing from me!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Not a single shred of information? Just as I expected. These revolutionaries would not have evaded capture for so long without the masses' complicity. Still, it is good to know that Tataru's ears are as sharp as ever.

obj.n: He Who Would Not Be Denied
